result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Jonathan Brown IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roy Jonathan Brown IV is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roy Jonathan Brown IV was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Roy Jonathan Brown IV was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Roy Jonathan Brown IV was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED.
Huber granted for work/seek work.

Concurrent.
Defendant to meet with Probation today May 12, 2016.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Defendant to meet with Child Support today May 12, 2016 to seek assistance.
-Defendant to maintain full-time employment or successfully receive disability.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Aiden Tharp DF: Roy Jonathan Brown appeared. Case called at 1:00. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. ADA Kelly updates the court and makes sentencing recommendations. DE has not made any pmts. since Nov. 2013. Atty. Tharp responds. DE makes statement. Court orders: Sentence I/S 
Ct. 1
- 3 months St. Croix County Jail 
  Huber granted for work and seek work. 
2 year probation with conditions to run concurrent
- DE to stay current with CS beginning in June 1.
- DE to meet with child support agency today to seek assistance.
- DE to maintain full time employment or successfully receive disability.

Ct. 2
- 3 months St. Croix County Jail  to run consecutive with Ct. 1
  Huber granted for work and seek work. 
2 year probation to run concurrent with Ct. 1
- Costs
- same conditions as Ct. 1

Ct. 3
 - 4 months St. Croix County Jail  to run consecutive with Ct. 2
  Huber granted for work and seek work. 
2 year probation to run concurrent with Ct. 2

- Costs
- same conditions as Ct. 1

DE to meet with probation today. Costs to be paid during probation
Sentencing hearing at 05-12-2016 01:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Aiden Tharp DF: Roy Jonathan Brown appeared. Case called at 1:34. Court reviews file and the request to revoke the DJOC. DE has failed to make any child support payments since July. ADA Kelly updates the court. Court accepts offer of proof from the State without objection from Atty. Tharp. Court vacates the agreement and enter the judgment for the three misdemeanor offenses. There is a joint request to set the sentencing out a few months to see if DE obtains employment. Atty. Tharp agrees. DE is still under bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Diess, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski  DF: Roy Jonathan Brown appeared. Case called at 11:39. State has filed an amended information.  ADA Hartung updates the court, there is a deferred JOC. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to the amended charges in Ct 1,2 and 3 in 15CF11. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1,2and 3 in the amended information in  15CF11. Court signs the DJOC.
Plea hearing on July 21, 2015 at 11:30 am.
